page.title: Reaction Rules
page.introduction:
Reaction Rules are defined alongside regular reactions and describe transformations of species. Each reaction rule has three basic elements: reactant pattern(s), product pattern(s), and a rate law specification.
Reactant pattern(s) select reactant species undergoing transformation.
Product pattern(s) define the end result of transformation. Product pattern may differ from reactant by re-assigning molecules, adding or deleting bonds and changing site states.
The default rate law is Mass Action specified in Kinetics bottom pane. Every reaction generated by the rule is assigned a rate given by the product of a multiplicity factor generated automatically by BioNetGen , the specified rate constants (which may be a numerical value or a formula), and the population levels of the reactants.
Reaction rule is specified in Editor bottom pane by declaring reactant patterns, that consist of previously defined molecules. The VCell editor will enable only correct specification of each reactant and product pattern.
page.appearance:
The Reactions Tab has several columns:
Reaction column has uneditable Reaction Rule mark in place of reaction notation for regular reactions.
Name column has a sortable name that is autogenerated as r_number but can be edited.
structure that contains a rule. For rule-based models, this field is uneditable, as a model may contain only one compartment.
Depiction shows the structure of the reactant and product species patterns. Green sites have either binding or state specified, white sites are undefined and can be connected to anything or be in multiple states (if yellow shape is shown).States of sites is omitted for clarity.
Kinetics is Mass Action and is currently uneditable.
BioNetGen Definition provides BNGL string with rule encoding. It is uneditable but searchable.
Link does not work for reaction rules at this time.
The bottom pane of the window displays a Reaction Rules Properties pane.

list.item: New Rule will create a new Reaction Rule. The only way to edit the new rule is via properties pane below.
Search the list of reactions and reaction rules using the Search Box to enter reaction rule name or any part of BNGL string.
Delete reaction and reaction rules by highlighting and using the "Delete" button below the table.
Duplicate will create an exact copy of highlighted rule with a new name oldname_0. This is very useful feature when a new rule is a slight modification of the previous one.
View, edit or Add annotation for existing reaction rules using Editor pane in the bottom of the window.
Edit kinetics for existing reaction rules using Kinetics pane in the bottom of the window.
